alert.note: Alert for Autauga (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 15 at 8:34AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: .Heavy rain will continue to impact the Montgomery metro area this morning. Ponding of water on roads could create hazardous driving conditions. Minor flooding in low lying areas is expected. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Autauga, Bullock, Elmore, Lowndes, Macon and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 832 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Montgomery, Prattville, Millbrook, Wetumpka, Pike Road, Coosada, Shorter, Pinedale, Snowdoun, Alabama State University, Hyundai Motors Of Alabama, Eastdale Mall, Alabama State Capitol, Auburn University In Montgomery, Montgomery Riverwalk Stadium, Gunter Air Force Base, Hope Hull, Lagoon Park, Woodcrest and Montgomery Zoo.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
